available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: Our medium-bodied Brown Ale is brewed in the  English tradition, with an infusion of American  creativity.  The rich, malty backbone balances an assertive hop character, and ends with a smooth,  dry finish.  Our Brown Ale boasts a dark brown body that supports a creamy tan head.

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Brown Ale

foodPairings: Rich Dishes, Chocolate Chip Cookies, Duck
name: Brown Ale

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

description: Low in alcohol with light toasty notes and a gentle hint of roastiness in the finish, this beer is dry at the end making you want to take another sip.

name: Brown Ale

description: This beer is more oriented on the American side of brown ales. Not bitter, as the hops are added late during the boil for more of it’s aromatic qualities. Notice the fruity nose and chocolate malt flavors to make this what the staff calls a gentle beer.

description: Medium to high malty flavor (often with caramel, toasty and/or chocolate flavors), with medium to medium-high bitterness. The medium to medium-dry finish provides an aftertaste having both malt and hops. Hop flavor can be light to moderate, and may optionally have a citrusy character

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. name: Brown Ale

description: Our Brown is simply put…. amazing! Styled as a Northern English Nut Brown Ale, it carries the same malty sweetness you would expect of the category but with a slight California hop twist. This is designed and carried through to be particularly malty, creamy, and thick. Taste-wise it is similar to Lost Coast’s Downtown Brown but with a slightly drier, hoppier finish. It is 5.5% ABV and frankly goes awesome with a steak, burger, bbq, or anything with a strong meaty flavor (and ironically makes a great dessert beer with some vanilla ice cream).

style.description: English brown ales range from copper to brown in color. They have medium body and range from dry to sweet maltiness with very little hop flavor or aroma. Roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Low to medium-low levels of fruity-ester flavors are appropriate. Diacetyl should be very low, if evident. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: English-Style Brown Ale

name: Brown Ale

available.description: Limited availability.
available.name: Limited

description: Great Crescent Brown Ale was crafted to fall between our Mild Ale and Porter in respect to flavor and bitterness. This beer stands on a base of genuine British brown, crystal and chocolate malts with bittering provided by 17%aa Summit Hops. The maltiness and bitteness blend together perfectly and the blend of U.K Fuggles and Goldings for flavor come through in the finish.

description:
A dark, malty ale with a slightly toasty after taste. A good amount of Crystal Malt gives this beer its dark caramel flavor. The hops are fairly subdued in this English style ale. This type of beer is popular in Northern England and is possible the oldest style of ale being brewed.

Malt Varieties: Pale Malt, Crystal Malt, Chocolate Malt
Hop Varieties: Northdown, Fuggles

style.description: English brown ales range from copper to brown in color. They have medium body and range from dry to sweet maltiness with very little hop flavor or aroma. Roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Low to medium-low levels of fruity-ester flavors are appropriate. Diacetyl should be very low, if evident. name: Brown Ale

description: An American Brown Ale, deep brown in color with rich malt, chocolate-caramel, nutty and toasty flavor. American Hops give it a citrus hop flavor and aroma. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Munich Malt, Honey Malt, Caramunich Malt, Caramel Malt, Chocolate Malt, Wheat Malt and Oat malt. Hopped with Summit, Ahtanum, Simcoe and Cascade. Year Round Flagship. Brown Ale contains 5.5% ABV.

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: Ah, yes, the humble and often overlooked brown ale! Here at Helms we love the rich, bready, and toffee like malt profile of this style. 6 different malts contribute to this complex medium bodied brew. We use just a touch of hops to provide a lovely counter point for the natural sweetness of barley. This beer pairs well with stews, BBQ, chili & chocolates of all types.

hops.description: Released in 2000, Warrior is an open pollinated very high alpha acid bittering hop variety with an American grapefruit citrus character. It is a proprietary hop, and the name "Warrior" is a registered trademark of Yakima Chief Ranches, LLC.
hops.name: Warrior

malt.description: Unmalted and roasted at high temperature to create a burnt, grainy, coffee-like flavor. Imparts a red to deep brown color to beer, and very strong roasted flavor. Use 2-4% in Brown ales to add a nutty flavor, or 3-10% in Porters and Stouts for coffee flavor.

characteristics.description: Imparts a burnt tasting quality upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Burnt

characteristics.description: Imparts a coffee flavor upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Coffee

characteristics.description: Imparts a grainty taste upon the beer.

malt.description: Another Belgian malt, this gives a biscuit like flavor and aroma. Use for English ales, brown ales and porters. Can be used as a substitute for toasted malt.
malt.name: Biscuit Malt

malt.description: Dextrine malt is a general term for a set of malts, including CaraPils and others, used to increase foam, head retention, sweetness, and body. Dextrine malts contain a lot of dextrins, sugar structures that are resistant to enzyme action that remain in the finished beer.

characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.
characteristics.name: Body

characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.
characteristics.name: Head

malt.name: CaraPils/Dextrin Malt

malt.description: Aromatic malt from Bamberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.
malt.name: Melanoidin Malt

malt.description: The is the standard starting point for almost all beer recipes. Smooth with a less grainy more moderate flavour.
malt.name: Two-Row Pale Malt

description: This traditional version of a British style Brown Ale has a rich, malty aroma reminiscent of fresh-baked multi-grain bread with some moderate caramel notes. Caramel and toffee sweetness with hints of bread and dark fruit flavors are balanced with a medium body and smooth finish. Little to no hop aromas or bitterness makes this a perfect beer for anyone who craves an easy drinking, malty beer.

description: Our biggest offering, weighing in at 7% ABV, our brown ale is a malty, hoppy union.  Caramelized brown sugar is added during the brewing process which adds to the Robust malt flavors of caramel, bittersweet chocolate, and coffee that dominate the taste profile.  Earthy hops assert themselves and arrive at a perfect balance with the malt sweetness.  The body is medium to keep this beer very drinkable and the aroma is of cocoa, and caramel with a hint of sweetness.

description:
Best Brown in Town
Dark brown and ruby hued, this ale expresses notes of espresso and chocolate. Very approachable, Wild Rose Brown Ale is mildly hopped with a medium body and a clean finish. Don't be afraid of the dark. Get down with the Brown.

style.description: English pale mild ales range from golden to amber in color. Malt flavor dominates the flavor profile with little hop bitterness or flavor. Hop aroma can be light. description: Our most popular beer, Legend Brown Ale is a full bodied version of a British-style Brown Ale. Generous amounts of specialty malts bring flavors of sweet caramel, toasted nuts, coffee, and molasses, all perfectly balanced by a steady but cautious hop dryness. Fruity undertones brought forth by our house yeast strain round out Richmond's favorite brew. Expect a rich, malt-forward brew with a beautiful mahogany tone.

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Brown Ale

name: Brown Ale

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: Delve into this deep amber colored beer and you'll find a lightly roasted maltiness coupled with a crisp body and lightly hopped goodness.
